issue.title: Release 7.0.0 - December 2023

labels.name: P1
labels.description: I'll work on this now. (Assignee required)

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
# Status of Bazel 7.0.0

-   Expected first release candidate date: October 17, 2023
-   Expected final release candidate date: December 6, 2023
-   Expected release date: December 11, 2023
-   [List of release blockers](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/milestone/55)

To report a release-blocking bug, please add a comment with the text `@bazel-io flag` to the issue. A release manager will triage it and add it to the milestone.

To cherry-pick a mainline commit into 7.0.0, simply send a PR against the `release-7.0.0` branch. (This branch will be created in October.)

**Task list:**

-   [x] Pick release baseline: 0a2aac4e3c6f5ef98fc233e2ce83e44930edb188
-   [x] Create release candidate: https://releases.bazel.build/7.0.0/rc1/index.html
-   [x] Check [downstream projects](https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazel-at-head-plus-downstream/builds/3395)
-   [x] Create [draft release announcement](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1clxBctsjpei40wqqjwiU2EltTzsrf_kvZ4dJyZVqghM/edit#heading=h.oanqk3j2ty6c) <!-- Note that there should be a new Bazel Release Announcement document for every major release. For minor and patch releases, use the latest open doc. -->
-   [x] Push the release and notify package maintainers
-   [x] Update the documentation
-   [x] Push the blog post
-   [x] Update the [release page](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/)

body: It's due to the upgrade to JDK21 where the implementation of ForkJoinPool has changed -- the number of core threads is larger than `--jobs`. I can get the old behaviour by using `--experimental_use_semaphore_for_jobs` with your repro. We probably should flip and remove this flag.

milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 7.1.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body:
> It's due to the upgrade to JDK21 where the implementation of ForkJoinPool has changed -- the number of core threads is larger than `--jobs`. I can get the old behaviour by using `--experimental_use_semaphore_for_jobs` with your repro. We probably should flip and remove this flag.

Thanks for looking into it. Yes, using `--experimental_use_semaphore_for_jobs` helped. Thanks for sharing this workaround!

issue.title: [7.1.0] Flip flag `--experimental_use_semaphore_for_jobs`.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Bazel 7 upgrades its runtime JVM to 21. However, the implementation of `ForkJoinPool` in JDK 21 is changed so that the number of concurrent actions may be larger than `--jobs`.

Flag `--experimental_use_semaphore_for_jobs` was introduced to fix this problem. This CL flips it to make `--jobs` work again by default.

Fixes #20521.

Commit https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/3c298fdb868d17d30ef5c19b3f3b488e5ed2c8a9

PiperOrigin-RevId: 590834204
Change-Id: I0ddf1e1a088eb4d917036350533df94c17ac48e6

body: A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 7.1.0 RC1](https://releases.bazel.build/7.1.0/rc1/index.html). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible. Thanks!
